body:
I gave some thought to Jose's idea. The problem is that Sanitizer is an internal class. Moreover it's going very deep into implementation. This make it hard to pass own sanitizer instance and even own sanitizer class to `#sanitize_from_mass_assignment` method without significant changes to the current implementation.

The only thing I can propose connected with callback is something like this:

```
ActiveModel::MassAssignmentSecurity::Sanitizer.on_error = lambda {|attrs|
  raise StandardError
}
```

And implementation like this:

```
      def process_removed_keys(attrs)
        if callback = self.class.on_error
          callback.call(attrs)
        else
          self.logger.debug "WARNING: Can't mass-assign protected attributes: #{attrs.join(', ')}" if self.logger
        end
      end
```

But this is still a configuration option.


What do you think?
